listing.listing_description: Combining 3 stand-alone villas, this hillside estate on Paros is the perfect vacation spot for a couples retreat, multi-family vacation, and those who appreciate a little extra privacy. Hang out on the rooftop garden as the sun sets beyond the mountains. Sip cocktails under the shaded pergola as you watch the sailboats in the harbor. Then, charter yourself a boat and explore the isles. The soft and soothing tones of Cycladic architecture will take you to new levels of relaxation at Nereids Villa Estate. Wander the property and discover reading nooks in the garden, shady spots for afternoon naps, and 3 swimming pools. Each villa has a fully-equipped kitchen, so let your culinary creativity run wild. Then, dine outside amongst the fresh sea breeze and island landscape. Feel like barbeque? Head into town and pick up some fresh fish from a local market, maybe grab some beers too. Then spend the afternoon lounging on the terrace, working on your tan in a sun chair, and popping in and out of the pool. At night, check what for a soccer match on the Smart TV or move the party to the rooftop garden for some star gazing. Ready for a night on the town? Make your way to Parikia or Naoussa, the island’s most popular villages where the narrow, winding streets are lined with restaurants, bars, and night clubs. If you’d rather keep it low-key, Paros Village has a more historic-vibe and traditional Greek cuisine. In the mornings, Paros’ wind conditions are ideal for watersports; it’s the perfect time to try surfing. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Stardust is a recently built private property in the area of Fanari area – in the northwestern part of Mykonos. Its privileged hill top position provides splendid sea and sunset views.The comfortable outdoor areas, which are perfectly equipped for guests relaxation through intriguing solutions either on the pool terrace and other smaller spaces on different levels of the house, are all appointed with charming sun beds and cushions.The property is developed on three levels, all bearing the same contemporary pseudo-minimal taste with a dominance of white and blue tones giving a refined yet smart ambiance throughout. All bedrooms share the same standard of amenities and style granting an optimal level of comfort to all guests.Within the vicinity of Stardust we are also proud to offer its sister villas, Moon Shadow and Crystal Sea, providing a great option for larger groups who wish to be close yet retain a good level of privacy in nearly identical properties

listing.listing_description: This beachfront villa is situated on the Palm Jumeirah of Dubai, at the end of a private gated road, with beautiful views of Dubai Marina. Ample outdoor living areas include a swimming pool and alfresco dining, while the superb interiors feature beautiful living and dining areas, a gourmet kitchen, and a home office. Six exquisite bedrooms suites with king or queen beds and ensuite bathrooms accommodate twelve guests, forming an ideal haven for family vacations or corporate retreats.The estate offers a rare degree of serenity amid the splendors of Dubai, with a wide stretch of private beach frontage and generous space for outdoor enjoyments. Dip into the refreshing pool and bask in the brilliant sun. Sip cool refreshments in the shade of parasols or in the lovely waterfront cabana, relaxing on the bed swing in the gentle breeze. Dine alfresco at sunset, and linger on the veranda during the glittering night.The interiors are luminous and spacious, ideal for festive occasions or placid relaxation. The living room features cozy and ample sectionals facing a large, flat-screen TV, while the stylish dining table seats twelve. Both of these rooms open through sliding glass doors to the veranda and yard, creating an expansive, indoor/outdoor space. The kitchen is fully equipped with chef-grade appliances and a breakfast bar, and there is a light-filled breakfast room as well.Upstairs, the office space offers an inspiring setting for study or work. There is also a separate media room with large sofas and a high-end TV. Throughout the villa, soothing wall tones and curtains complement the natural wood accents, beautiful artwork, and vintage ‘70s-era furnishings. Air conditioning ensures comfort at all times.The bedrooms provide spacious private havens for downtime and rest—a comfortable choice for multiple couples or destination wedding guests. There are five rooms with queen beds and two with kings. Five of the ensuite bathrooms have tubs. The fifth bedroom enjoys sea views, a private balcony, and a lounge.From this secluded abode on Frond D of the Palm Jumeirah, you're within easy reach of several famed hotels and nightlife spots on the island, including the Atlantis, as well as the family-friendly Aquaventure Waterpark. Dubai Marina is less than ten kilometers away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Tucked into a vast estate located in the Kolimpithres area of Paros, only a few minutes away from a sandy cove with crystal waters, Senna is a beautiful mansion that offers seclusion and tranquility. This exquisite vacation rental sits peacefully amid its untouched natural surroundings that offer a sense of harmony and balance. Mindful of the traditional Cycladic design, the architect has created a playful synthesis of interconnected cubes and smartly allocated internal patios.The main gate opens to a charming pebbled patio. Its whitewashed walls are pierced by small windows and lit by handmade lanterns. Thoughtfully integrated into the natural setting, the outdoor areas convey a bohemian-chic atmosphere. At the back of the house, the swimming pool offers a secluded hideaway that can be accessed via two master bedrooms. You will also find a lovely alfresco dining set, a wood oven and a barbeque. Interior perks include an espresso machine, satellite television and Wi-Fi. Your reservation includes housekeeping and chef services.The living room, kitchen and guest bedroom enclose a superb central patio with large, luxury sofas and views to the meadow. The interior is bright and airy, with spacious living areas and large openings. The living room has been elegantly decorated, with signature furnishings accentuated by French country details. The palette is mostly white, complimented by wooden ceilings and floors. An adjacent formal dining area is served by a large kitchen with a central unit that would please even the most demanding chefs. Senna is perfect for a family getaway or a special celebration like a wedding.Carefully appointed, the spacious bedrooms feature large windows and sparkling views. Wooden ceilings, floors and ornaments are made of natural materials that convey a sense of familiarity and comfort. Five bedrooms accommodate up to ten guests. The two independent guestrooms feature separate entrances and open to the central patio.Senna in Paros offers the opportunity for that private dream holiday in the sun. The area is known for some of the most beautiful beaches in the Greek islands, characterized by crystal clear water and a relaxing ambience. Some beaches in Paros are lined up with hotels, beach bars and restaurants, while others are remote and secluded. The eastern beaches are renown for windsurfing and kite surfing. However you spend your time in Greece, be sure to have your vacation, your way!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Perched at the edge of a lush nature reserve, this villa boasts sea views overlooking the island of Naxos. Famous Cycladic architect Kostas Gouzelis brings together a minimalist approach to the interior with expansive outdoor space. It’s surrounded by a bountiful fruit orchard, known in the ancient maps of Paros as “the old garden.” Pack a picnic and drive a short, scenic route to Tsoukalia Beach.Inside, panoramic ocean and mountain vistas can be admired from each room. Modern furniture mixes with Athenian antiques to create a refreshingly eclectic aesthetic. With direct access to the garden from the kitchen, farm fresh fare is mere steps away. Home-grown figs, lemons, apricots, and grapes make for the sweetest desserts or snacks. Under the terrace pergola, set the table for 10 and dine alfresco with nothing but a gentle breeze and the sound of rippling tides. The sun-soaked terrace features a bar where you can sit in the evenings with a G&T or first thing in the morning with a cold-pressed juice. Take a break from returning emails in the office space to seek out one of the abode’s secluded areas and dive into a juicy novel. The turquoise-hued infinity pool invites you to cool down on blazing afternoons. A 5-minute drive lands you in Isterni where you’ll have access to authentic Greek cuisine. Plan a day trip to Kolympethres and swim in the crystal clear water, rent an umbrella and lounger, and stop by a quaint café before returning to the undeniable tranquility of Villa Orian.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Just meters from one of the most tranquil and picturesque beaches of Paros, Santa Maria Beach House offers a rare beachfront experience in Greece. This lovely 4-bedroom island beach house is cushioned by a lush private garden and enjoys tranquil views of the sea and surrounding neighborhood. A romantic private stone path, shielded by a bamboo grove, meanders down to the sandy beach where you can sunbathe, swim or snorkel to your heart’s content, just two minutes’ walk from the house.Authentically Greek chalky white walls are offset by the cornflower blue of the sea and sky. Outdoor living is abundant during the summer months and there are plenty of places to soak up the gorgeous views, meditate or strike your yoga poses on the terrace. An al fresco dining area, shaded by a pergola, is perfect for laid-back lunches and romantic starlit dinners.Step inside and you’ll immediately be impressed by how quickly the simple, uncluttered living spaces can clear your mind. Perhaps it’s the scent of the lemon groves or the ozone-laden sea breezes that make you feel clean and wholesome here. The living room is a pleasant spot for indulging in a good book while the sun is at its peak, or gathering with friends or family to watch DVDs on the satellite television. There’s also Wi-Fi throughout if you need to stay connected. An open-plan kitchen and informal dining area are designed for preparing and enjoying family meals, or you may decide to take breakfast on the terrace.All that fresh sea air is bound to make you sleepy, so you’ll be glad to retire to the comfort of your fan-cooled bedroom. All four are simply styled for rest and relaxation, with traditional shuttered windows to block out the bright Greek sun when you need to sleep. En-suite facilities add a touch of luxury and the upstairs master bedroom has access to a rooftop terrace – where better to start the day with a freshly brewed morning coffee as you survey the Mediterranean garden and sea beyond? The other three bedrooms are equally comfortable and enjoy lovely views from the lower level.The charming island of Paros is easy to get around in a rental vehicle and there is plenty to see and do on your doorstep. It’s a 2 minute walk to Santa Maria beach, 2 km to the shops and 8 km to the nearest town. The airport is 15 km.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Discover the hidden charms of Paros at Villa Drazen. Set on a quiet hillside near the town of Ambelas, the sun-drenched villa has views over the terraced landscape to the Aegean Sea. A traditional mix of whitewashed and stone walls and three bedrooms, including one in a separate guest house, provide an enchanting setting for a romantic getaway or family vacation.The heart of the villa is a large, sunny terrace with ocean views, an L-shaped infinity pool and plenty of daybeds and chairs for lounging. A covered pergola with a dining table is a shaded spot for al-fresco meals. Other outdoor features include a gas barbecue, shower, built-in sitting area and a second-floor balcony. Inside, the villa has a sound system and Wi-Fi for entertainment and a wine cellar to house your newly discovered Greek vintages.As you’d expect from a home on the Greek islands, the interiors of Villa Drazen have airy whitewashed walls and cool marble floors, with some wood-beamed ceilings adding natural texture. In the living room, neutral-toned sofas, a decorative fireplace and Moroccan-style accents create an atmosphere that’s both serene and cozy. The adjacent dining area, which seats eight, has a large picture window looking out to the pool and ocean, and opens to the terrace. Just beyond the dining area, the fully equipped kitchen has warm brick and cream cabinets and a practical island layout.There are two bedrooms in the main house at Villa Drazen and one in a separate guest house. Each bedroom has a double bed and en-suite bathroom with shower. In the main house, there’s one bedroom on the ground floor and one bedroom upstairs, which opens to the balcony. The guest house has its own kitchenette and sitting area in addition to the bedroom.During your stay, have a swim in the Aegean at Contaratos Beach, 5 km away, or Santa Maria Beach, 8 km away. Villa Drazen is 5 km from the town of Naoussa, 13 km from the port of Parikia, 14 km from the town of Paros, and 26 km from the town of Alyki. If you’ll be flying to or from Paros, the island’s national airport is about a 16 km drive from the villa.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Whether you need an adventure in the Greek islands or a sun-soaked week of relaxation, you can find it at Neptunea. This waterfront Mykonos vacation rental is beautifully suited to a quiet holiday with family, thanks to its stunning location and expansive outdoor living areas. If you want more excitement, it's only a short drive from hot spots like Agios Ioannis and Mykonos Town.Savor the views of the Aegean and the neighboring island of Delos from a private terrace featuring a saltwater pool, loungers and sunbeds under umbrellas and a pergola, a wood-fired barbecue and an al-fresco dining area. After the sun sets, settle in by the television, sound system and Wi-Fi for a laid-back evening.Inside Neptunea, white walls and beamed ceilings create a traditionally inspired yet restful ambience. Several sets of french doors flood the living areas with sunshine, and archways separating the two dining areas from the living room and fully equipped kitchen give the rooms an easy flow. A one-level layout makes this luxury home ideal for groups of all ages.There are three bedrooms in the main house at Neptunea: one master suite with a double bed, en-suite bathroom and sea views, and two bedrooms with double beds and hall bathroom access. There is also a guest house with a queen bed and en-suite bathroom, whose separate entrance means it could be used as a honeymoon-esque retreat or a quieter space for in-laws.From the villa's waterfront setting, it's only a few minutes' drive to some of the island's best beaches, from the calm, clear waters of Kapari Beach to the soft sands of Agios Ioannis. Pick up necessities at the nearby shops or make the quick trip into Mykonos Town to explore its boutiques, galleries, museums, historic sites and, of course, its restaurants.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Experience the Greek islands’ sea, sun and white stucco at Villa Jackson on Paros. Just minutes away from the Agia Eirini beach, the property has stunning views of the sunset over the Aegean Sea. Six bedrooms spread out over two houses and two studios make this villa ideal for family events or groups of friends.Soak in the sun from the pool overlooking the ocean or one of the chaise longues on the pool terrace. There’s an outdoor shower for post-swim rinses, a barbecue for grilling local seafood and an al-fresco dining area for dinners with sunset views. An inner courtyard is the perfect spot for a sunny breakfast or relaxed lunch. Gather around the television and DVD player in the evenings, stay connected via Wi-Fi, and flip on the ceiling fans on warmer nights.White interiors with floor-to-ceiling windows are both a nod to traditional Greek island architecture and a contemporary statement. In open-plan living and dining room, sunlight washes over pale concrete floors and white walls, tables and light fixtures and bounces off colorful accents like a mod turquoise sectional and translucent dining chairs. One fully equipped kitchen continues the minimalist vibe with white cabinets and stainless steel appliances, while the other goes bold with pops of near-neon orange.Villa Jackson has two houses with two bedrooms, and two studios with one bedroom each. All of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning. In each house, there’s one bedroom with a double bed and one bedroom with two twin beds. In each studio, there’s one bedroom with a double bed, and available sofa beds for additional accommodations.From the villa, Agia Eirini beach is only a 10 minute walk away. It’s a 6 km drive to Paroikia Port, and about 6 km to either the town of Paroikia or Paros. Explore Contaratos Beach, just under 16 km away, or Santa Maria Beach, 16 km away. Paros National Airport is also about 6 km away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Experience the very finest in beachfront access at this premium coastal palace, located in one of Dubai’s most central neighborhoods. With a huge rooftop deck, cool rooms, pool and spacious driveway, guests can relax in privacy, complete a real touch of Gulf glamour. Arrive to next-level comfort after a long flight, and look forward to exploring Dubai’s cosmopolitan downtown and pristine beaches.Step into air-conditioned freshness the moment you pass through the doors of this coastal villa, with the famous heat of Dubai sliding off you as the polished wooden floors, tasteful decor and ornate, Arabian windows of the property stretch in front of you. Kick off the day in the cooler mornings with a delicious breakfast on the shaded balcony, as the waves lap up to touch the golden sands of the beach opposite the property. At any point, the villa’s refreshing pool is there for a rejuvenating dip, while the comfortable living areas, complete entertainment system and sheer space of the property ensures that both kids and adult groups can enjoy things in their own style. Finally, take pleasure in wholesome group meals at the expansive formal dining table or outdoor seats.Kite Palace is ideally located for those looking to experience all the best aspects of modern Dubai. The city’s famous beaches are literally on the doorstep, with renowned Kite Beach being just a handful of steps away. Here, guests can indulge in swimming and sunbathing, with diverse watersports outings and a kids play-area all on offer. The villa is just a handful of minutes by car from the waterparks and stunning hotels of the Palm Jumeirah district, while the jaw-dropping skyscrapers and world-renowned shopping of the central district are easily accessible. As the day cools down, make the straight-forward trip back to the villa and savor a cool drink on the balcony as the city’s lights glow along the coastline.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Be a part of Dubai’s famous city-skyline at this contemporary penthouse in the Cayan Tower. Marvel at bird’s eye views capturing some of modern architecture’s most incredible buildings, including the Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina. Once you’ve got a lay of the land, walk over to the beach, stroll along the canals to the yacht club, or head to the marina district for dinner at Pier 7.Start your morning looking out over the marina from the master ensuite’s spa-like soaking tub. Enjoy your morning Nespresso at the kitchen’s breakfast bar, or have it out on the balcony, letting the city-view inspire plans for the rest of the day. Back inside, designer furniture, lavish fixtures, and high-end electronics decorate the penthouse’s spacious layout.Celebrating something special? Bring in a private chef and enjoy a meal in the formal dining area. After, mix a few cocktails to sip while you show off the view from the lounge. If you’re traveling with kids, they’ll love having easy access to the private plunge pool. And, if you’re keeping up with any fitness routines, the building’s shared pools, gym, and sauna are ready when you are.For an exciting afternoon with the family, head to Wild Wadi Waterpark or Aquaventure. If you’re in the mood to shop, Dubai Mall is the largest retail-entertainment location on the planet. Looking for adventure? Try indoor skiing at Ski Dubai, located within the Mall of Emirates, or charter a fishing boat at the Yacht Club. And, no trip to Dubai is complete without spending an afternoon on JBR Beach.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Located on the most beautiful oceanfront on the isle of Mykonos, Kyma villa makes a great bet for a family or a group of friends seeking some Mediterranean fun in the sun. Ftelia Beach is renowned for being one of the longest sandy beaches on the island and is particularly popular for windsurfing. Within this idyllic setting, Kyma distinguishes itself, just a few steps above the beachfront with a view across the bay over the Aegean.The outdoor spaces at this stunning vacation rental have been developed on two interconnected levels. The contoured, infinity-edge swimming pool provides the optical illusion of almost blending its waters with those of the sea. The alfresco living areas are shaded by an ample pergola on the upper level of the terrace, while cast iron furnishing and a lovely wooden dining table allow for outdoor cocktails and cuisine any time of the day. With an exterior bar, an outdoor sound system piping tunes and sun loungers, Kyma is perfect for the consummate entertainer.A defined maritime theme combined with tasteful decor indoors create a stunning private retreat without compromising the more typical elements of Cycladic architecture, such as the cimentogonia used in the flooring and bathrooms. Cool white spaces and contemporary furnishings provide that quintessential Mykonos vibration. The upper level hosts the living room and kitchen, both of which have direct access to the terrace.The five elegant bedrooms with en-suite bathrooms at this non-smoking villa are split between the two levels, accommodating up to ten guests. All of the suites provide air conditioning and ceiling fans. You will find double beds in four suites and ocean views in three. Get the rest and relaxation you deserve with Luxury Retreats!Kyma makes a great choice for guests looking for an island property just on the beach, complemented by fresh interior decoration and modern amenities. Beach access is via a stone staircase from the deck of the villa. This coveted location and setting has also made Kyma an ongoing destination for fairytale bay weddings and other special events. What are you celebrating?Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Poseidon Two is part of a group of three properties freshly inaugurated in the area of Kalafatis Beach, on the southeastern side of Mykonos. The villa grants easy access to the lovely beaches down below which are also a windsurfer’s delight. You can also take a jaunt to Agia Anna, a beautiful small cove. A Greek paradise awaits!Poseidon Two’s infinity swimming pool offers stunning views over Kalafatis Bay. On the lower level of the house, there is a unique aquarium-style window which actually looks into the pool. The pool level terrace features loads of outdoor lounging and dining spaces in both sun and shade. You can also take a well deserved soak in the hot tub on the upper verandah. A cozy outdoor dining area with a barbeque on the side of the terrace is ideal for alfresco dining. Indoors, you will find satellite television, DVD player, Hi-Fi sound and Wi-Fi access. Your reservation includes daily housekeeping.Poseidon Two was built with traditional Cycladic architectural design, pristine white surfaces and stone structures. The beautifully furnished lounge room with its adjoining dining area have a stylish atmosphere and soft colors embellish the space. The modern kitchen is well designed and fully functional with all necessary amenities for the culinary genius in the group.Seven delectable bedrooms accommodate up to fourteen guests at Poseidon Two. All of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms, and the one features the aquarium-style window looking into the swimming pool. You will find double beds in all of the bedrooms, and the bunk beds are sure to be a hit with children.The possibility of visiting some of the lesser known beaches of Mykonos combined with the stylish design of this property make Poseidon Two the perfect spot for groups or families looking to embrace the rich experiences offered by this magical island of the Aegean Sea. The sheer beauty and picturesque environs also make Poseidon Two a favorite spot for exclusive weddings, birthdays and other special events. Inhale the sweet fragrance of geraniums mingled with bougainvillea as you coast your way through the sheer white abodes adorned with turquoise balconies, cloistered in this Greek paradise called Mykonos!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Sun, sea, sky and stylish accommodation: all the essentials for a memorable Greek islands holiday are close at hand at The G House. From its gorgeous terrace to its sophisticated interiors, this well-appointed vacation rental gives you the quintessential Mykonos experience. And if you'd like to explore the island, a location outside Tourlos close to both Mykonos Town and the popular Agios Stefanos beach makes it easy.Take in views stretching from Mykonos Town across the Aegean to Rhenia and Delos from expansive outdoor living areas with a pool, plenty of loungers, al-fresco dining and a wood-fired barbecue. After watching the sun go down over the neighboring islands, you can go out on the town or unwind in private with the help of the TV, sound system and Wi-Fi.A lush garden and traditionally inspired architecture lend The G House ample charm. The views extend to the living and dining rooms, thanks to an open-concept layout and multiple doors to the terrace, while a nearly all-white color scheme helps the sunlight bounce around the space. The adjacent fully equipped kitchen has a breakfast bar and opens to the outdoor dining area to make al-fresco meals a snap.The six bedrooms at this luxury property, all with en-suite bathrooms, can accommodate up to twelve friends or family members. There are four bedrooms with double beds, including two master suites with their own balconies facing the sea, and two bedrooms with queen beds.Though its hillside setting and the views of the town below make it feel secluded, The G House is just a short drive from the sandy beach of Agios Stefanos, the bustling new harbor in Tourlos, and central Mykonos Town, where you can explore boutiques, museums and galleries, stroll the historic streets, sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner at an oceanfront spot or enjoy a lively nightlife scene.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Located uphill in a unique wind-sheltered position in the Fanari area, The Eagle’s Nest villa enjoys one of the most beautiful panoramic views in all of Mykonos. This chic Greek villa overlooks the islands of Tinos, Syros and Delos in the Aegean archipelago. Magical sunsets are the pièce de résistance every night at this spectacular seaside villa!The infinity swimming pool features an intriguing shape—a large rectangle topped with a semicircle. The vast pool offers panoramic views while the infinity-edge creates the illusion of its waters mingling with those of the Mediterranean. With a built-in spa, you will emerge relaxed and rejuvenated like never before. The outdoor setting is well appointed with antique wooden furniture, curios and artifacts. There are several terraces and pergolas where you can recline in sun or shade. A wood fire barbeque sets the tone for lovely alfresco dining. Indoors at The Eagle’s Nest, you will find satellite TV, DVD/CD players and Wi-Fi access. Housekeeping is included with your reservation.The property is spread over several natural terraces connected by quaint stone paths. The Eagle’s Nest consists of three buildings—the main house and two separate guesthouses. The style and feel of this property combine typical Cycladic architecture with elements of Provencal country style giving this property a special charm and remarkable appeal. The main house features a beautiful open plan kitchen, while the living room is bright and cozy. One of the two guesthouses is located below the pool and main patio, while the second, with kitchenette, is located above the main villa, next to a tiny private chapel.Eight delectable bedrooms accommodate up to fourteen guests at The Eagle’s Nest. All of the bedrooms feature air conditioning, and there are six en-suite bathrooms. Four of the bedrooms offer direct terrace access, and the suite on the upper floor includes a rooftop terrace—perfect for starry nights!Nothing says Mykonos like sixteenth century windmills and the buildings perched on the water in Little Venice. Built on the water’s edge to accommodate the fast-paced lives of swashbuckling pirates, the Little Venice of today endures as the quintessential place for travelers to grab a bite as they watch the boats go by. The Paraportiani church and the island of Delos could also be on the itinerary during your stay at The Eagle’s Nest.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Watch as windsurfers navigate the shimmering waters of Ftelia Bay from this modern-Cycladic home in Mykonos. Catch up on some reading underneath the shade of the dining pergola while the kids splash around in the swimming pool. Then, sit back on a lounge chair as the sunsets beyond the distant mountains. In the morning, wake up early for a windsurfing lesson on Ftelia Beach. Flow between the main house, guest house, and multi-level terrace as freely as the sea breeze. Along the way, appreciate the natural elements of wood and stone that decorate and support the villa white stucco walls. Let the charcoal barbeque and fully-equipped kitchen inspire you to try your hand at traditional Greek cuisine. Then, dine alfresco, sipping wine as the stars begin to shine. If you’re keeping up with a fitness routine, the home gym is ready for you. After a workout, cool off in the pool or treat yourself to a Turkish bath and a soak in the hot tub. Not ready for any action yet? Throw a log on the fire and stretch out on the sofa while you stream something new on Smart TV. Now that your batteries are recharged, turn up the sound system and rally the troops for a wild night on the island. In the mood for seafood? Visit Alefkantra, better known as “Little Venice,” where colorful houses and incredible restaurants line the coast. On your way, stop in for a picture at the Mykonos Windmills, you’ll probably recognize them from all the postcards. For a deeper dive into the island’s history, check out the Archaeological Museum of Mykonos, known for their collection of unique vases, sculptures, and ceramics.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Updated Cycladic architecture and endless views of the Aegean Sea await at this multi-villa estate on the southern coast of Mykonos. Lay in a sun chair and gaze upon the neighboring islands. Curl up for a movie on the 4-meter projector screen in the home cinema. At night, do some stargazing from the hot tub or take a stroll along Super Paradise Beach, less than 1 kilometer from home. Exposed wood, natural stone, and white stucco walls are the trademark styles of the Cyclades, and Dante delivers authenticity. Once inside, take a moment to discover the thoughtfully selected pieces of modern furniture, the expertly designed farmhouse kitchen, and the privacy created by the 3 separate units. Back outside, pick your favorite vantage point on the winding terrace and settle in for the sunset. On quiet nights in, sit by the fireplace and catch up on some reading. Keep up with your fitness routine in the home gym. Or get cozy with that special someone in a sunbed. On not-so-quiet nights, fire up the barbecue, crank the sound system and organize a foosball tournament on the terrace, the losers have to jump in the pool.History buffs in the group will want to check out the windmills on the way to dinner in Little Venice. They are the island’s most recognizable landmark dating back to the 17th-Century. You could also spend an afternoon at the Folklore or Archaeological museums. Later, dance the night away at Cavo Paradiso, the island’s hottest club known for bringing in top DJs.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Set in one of the most privileged locations of southern Paros, villa Agassi is a gorgeous six bedroom summer home with striking views of the bay of Faragas and a breathtaking sunset. True to the vernacular architecture, the structure is composed of strict geometric forms, clean lines and dazzling white surfaces that create an interesting contrast with the soothing colors of the sea and sky.The outdoor pergola-shaped dining and lounge areas are adjacent to an L-shaped infinity pool that blends in the seascape, creating the illusion of weightlessness. The interior is composed of minimal ornamentation and flat surfaces as dictated by the less-is-more philosophy of the Cycladic design. Minimal yet ultimately luxurious, the living areas feature large openings that offer stunning views of the landscape. Stark-white walls accentuate the cutting-edge Italian furniture and a few carefully selected art pieces that are casually placed throughout the house.There is minimum usage of furniture and accessories, while great emphasis has been laid on spaciousness. The living room, kitchen and dining area are divided by high arches that add a geometric slant and optimize the illusion of openness. Orientated to offer views of the sea, the comfortable sofas and raw-wood coffee table are highlighted by the pale-colored polished stone floorings. The designer raw-wood dining table is served by a stylish kitchen that is fully equipped for home-cooking. In the same concept, the bedrooms are large and inviting, with designer furnishings and carefully selected upholstery aimed to pamper our senses and create an atmosphere of ultimate relaxation. All bedrooms lead to gorgeous verandas and offer stunning views of the settings. There are also two independent guest houses that are accordingly decorated and are ideal for couples or guests.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved

listing.listing_description: Notice how the color palette reminds you of the desert sands on which Dubai is built. The creamy sand color mixes with touches of the sun and sea, inside and out of this penthouse. Bespoke décor also reflects desert colors. Wrap around seating areas, textural golds and warm browns in fabrics, furniture, and accessories complement the 360-degree wall to wall glass views of the skyline of Dubai and the Dubai Marina. It’s pure elegance.Skylight penthouse has a grand viewing deck at the very top of The Palm property. A lovely heated swimming pool dominates the large deck. It’s where private sunning and swimming and having fun all happens. You have a birds-eye view over the white sand beach, swaying palms, and the Arabian gulf below. Bring binoculars to watch the yachts go in and out of the marina. A shaded alfresco dining area and conversation lounges are perfect for meals and snacks after a busy time at the Kids club.Evenings after dinner when the city skyline is all aglitter, where lights like little faeries twinkle from the yachts, light some lantern lights, and sit out with friends and family to feel the wonder of this magical sparkling place.The Palm Resort offers many additional amenities. Ask the concierge. The beach is below. Downtown Dubai is 22 km for shopping. It’s 6 km to Dubai Marina and 6.5 km to Emirates Golf Club.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved

listing.listing_description: The curved staircase draws your eye as much as the sweeping views atop the center of Dubai, in this residence. Clean, crisp lines, tasteful décor, and modern amenities make the space welcoming yet professional. Here for a conference? Are you meeting associates for some top-level thinking or last-minute contract negotiations? Our hospitality and attention to business service needs are impeccable.Jumeirah Living WTC 1307 residence is a part of the World Trade Centre residences and sits atop the city in the heart of Dubai’s business district. The rooftop pool is ideal at the end of a busy day to log a few laps, then relax poolside on a lounger to catch up on a bit of paperwork or catch a short nap. There’s also access to a shared fitness center. Gracious bedrooms with city views are on the second level. A galley kitchen, office, open living, and dining area, which could also work as a small conference room, is on the lower level, again all with striking city views.Being within walking distance to the Dubai World Trade Centre and Dubai Convention Centre there are many restaurants and shops are nearby. To visit points of interest, the Burj Khalifa is 5.7 km, and it’s 6 km to the Dubai Mall or Dubai Opera and 6.2 Km to the Dubai Fountain. listing.listing_description: Named in loving adoration of the prickliest of plants, The House of Kakti is home to Greece’s largest garden of blooming cacti. This exquisite property in Paros showcases an incredible array of colorful cactus varieties within a secluded locale that offers amazing views of the islands of Ios, Sikinos and Folegandros. Within walking distance from the house, one can choose between the sandy beach of Farangas or a series of scenic rocks interspersed with intimate mini-beaches.Showcasing classic Cycladic architecture, this stunning vacation rental raises the notion of seamless indoor/outdoor living to a crescendo. The sparkling infinity swimming pool gazes onto the cacti garden. You will also find a pergola with four giant sofas, an ideal spot for sunset drinks or siestas. The House of Kakti has been designed as a summer residence. The dining area is situated outside under a handcrafted pergola and has a beautiful view of the Mediterranean Sea. A barbeque is located in the rear of the house to minimize any unpleasant smoke.The southern positioning of the house reduces the effect of the Meltemi winds that typically blow from the north during the summer. The main living room is delightfully cozy and complemented by two exterior sitting areas that satisfy the needs of those who prefer being in comfort whilst enjoying the scenic outdoors. Having numerous sitting areas provides extra privacy. A fully equipped kitchen with Miele appliances will ensure flawless execution for the culinary genius in your entourage.Eight exquisite bedrooms accommodate up to sixteen guests at this non-smoking villa. The main house offers three master bedrooms and two additional bedrooms. The guest house faces the main terrace and includes an additional master bedroom and two large bedrooms. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning and ocean views.The House of Kakti is one of the most original properties in the Cyclades and will prove to be a memorable place to spend a tranquil vacation in Greece thanks to its combination of delectable interiors, generous outdoor spaces and stunning array of colors. This area of the island is not heavily populated with tourists, so it has a very local and authentic feeling. We recommend this private luxury home for a family holiday or a special celebration like a wedding, anniversary or birthday.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: So rare a home, this urban hideout sets the scene for a stay to remember. This home is ideal for the indulgent family or group of friends looking for the city stay in one of Dubai’s most vibrant neighborhoods. Located in the heart of City Walk, this home is a stone’s throw from the major attractions of the neighborhood.The design scheme has a Cosmopolitan approach to accent the grand scheme of the home. Without the coldness of most loft style apartments, comfort is at the focus. Contrasting materials come together to inspire a feeling of belonging that is signature to the design team behind it all. The living space opens into the dining and kitchen to create a large communal area where most of the action goes down. Blonde wood flooring adds warmth throughout the space. A small guest bathroom and fully equipped laundry room are at the entrance. The defining feature of the living space is a large floor to ceiling windows that boast views of Burj Khalifa and the occasional star gaze. Abstract artworks and vintage prints compliment the soft fabrics and wood furniture. The dining table is fit for a midsummer night's dream level dinner. The modern kitchen is fitted out with major appliances and sleek countertops. Open plan in structure, the fully accessorized kitchen is equipped for an elaborate cooking session. A classic Nespresso Machine lives here with complimentary capsules that come with every check in. Additional seating is at the kitchen countertop that doubles as a bar. The main entertainment area is just off the dining area with a massive L shape sofa. A flat screen 55-inch smart tv and sound bar promise a memorable night in with the pre-programmed Netflix for our Guests. On the ground floor is a cozy bedroom with an ensuite bathroom for the guest who wants to be close to the action.Up the wood and glass staircase one finds two modern bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms. The master bedroom is of eclectic design with textured headboards, a print dyed armchair, and small work station for the work/play balance. The queen size bed faces a smart TV placed to enjoy a movie before bed. Floor to ceiling windows overlook the main City Walk boulevard and views of Dubai. The bathroom is a minimal stand in shower. The second bedroom is just off the first with a more classic take on design - also with a queen size bed. A small balcony can be opened during cooler seasons. All linens are 400 thread count Egyptian Cotton that are freshly laundered pre-arrival. Fluffy towels are in abundance. Acqua Di Parma also makes a guest appearance from Parma Italy as an added luxury.

listing.listing_description: A green jewel bordering the desert metropolis, this Dubai villa is a plush, beautifully-designed retreat. Guests will love the outdoor pool, which is ringed by shady green trees and seasonal blossoms. Tastefully outfitted in a light-and-dark Arabian theme, the villa features white pillars, slick stone and captivating decor. Close to numerous restaurants, it is just 20 minutes from downtown Dubai.Built in a specially-constructed neighborhood, Chalet Noma provides guests with a delightful level of comfort and peacefulness. Situated on the edge of the desert plains, it provides 2 levels of serene luxury, with a triumphant hallways of stone pillars, and a magnificent chandelier. Guests can congregate in the pleasant shade of the terrace, sipping on cool drinks as trees sway in the breeze and the brilliant pool mirrors the clear sky above. Inside, the sumptuous living room and huge bedrooms ensures guests will feel like they’re receiving the royal treatment throughout their stay. The provided media room and fully-equipped entertainment system ensures that guests can thoroughly relax after a day of the country's famous heat, with the central air-conditioning keeping the climate at an ideal level throughout this impressive property.The villa itself is located in a pleasant, wooded settlement on the edge of the city, with a number of varied restaurants, stores and cafes within a short walk of the home. Dubai’s downtown is no more than 20 minutes by car, while the city’s famous beaches and glittering shopping districts thus being easily accessible. Guests can also visit world-famous attractions such as the Dubai Zoo in approximately 20 minutes, with safaris amongst dream-like dunes being a highly popular and close-by option. This is an excellent choice for those seeking a pleasant stay complete with a touch of desert calm, while still retaining access to this renowned world city.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: The sun, sea and natural stone make up the stunning backdrop to Aegean Oasis. Set on the rocks overlooking a quiet bay near Lia Beach, the five-bedroom villa is private and calm, away from the more well-traveled parts of Mykonos. The property has gorgeous views over the sea and unique architecture that incorporates the island’s rocks, but a location close to several other beaches makes day trips tempting, too.Aegean Oasis opens to several levels of terraces that spread out above the sea. The centerpiece is an infinity lagoon-style pool, but there’s also a sunny area with chaise longues, a sunken gazebo with built-in seating, and a pergola-covered outdoor dining area. Inside, you’ll find satellite TV, a sound system, Wi-Fi and even a grand piano for entertainment, as well as air conditioning.Throughout the villa, natural stone is juxtaposed with modern furnishings and contemporary art for intriguing, one-of-a-kind interiors. In the living room, cool white walls, a pared-down fireplace, stone floors and low-profile white sofas are enlivened by playful sculpture, large-scale paintings and French doors opening to the cliffs outside. Likewise, the dining room’s glass-topped table and klismos chairs provide traditional contrast for the avant-garde artwork and open-air layout. The fully equipped kitchen is fresh and minimalist, with white cabinets and stainless steel appliances, save for the textured rock wall at one end.For privacy, the villa’s five bedrooms are spread out across its three levels. Each bedroom has an en-suite bathroom, air conditioning, terrace access and sea views. The lower level and ground floor each have two bedrooms with double beds. Upstairs, on the mezzanine level, the master suite has a double bed and a bathroom built into the rock face.Aegean Oasis is convenient to the town of Ano Mera, 4 km away, Mykonos Tennis Club, 7 km away, Mykonos Island National Airport, 10 km away, and the town of Mykonos, 12 km away. There’s also a wealth of beaches nearby for you to explore; from the villa, it’s just under 3 km to Lia Beach, about 4 km to Kalo Livadi and the Kalafati beaches, 6 km to Elia Beach, 7 km to Panormos Beach and 10 km to Super Paradise Beach. Agios Sostis, Grand and Mykonos Paradise beaches are all about 13 km away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Situated in glorious seclusion on the southern coast of Mykonos, this villa is a popular choice for those seeking a dream stay in the Cyclades. Take to the sun-drenched patio or dive into the pristine blue pool. Spread over terraced levels, savor the bright, pristine kitchen and seaview balcony, before visiting dream beaches and peaceful villages nearby.Rest assured that Dolce Vita Mykonos represents an especially private and peaceful location on the island of Mykonos. Sheltered between two hills, the villa commands an enchanting view of the nearby coast. Gentle sea breezes caress the property, cooling the numerous shaded seating areas. Guests can take in the Greek sunlight from the warm stone terrace that runs alongside the impressive pool, or recline with a book or device on the upper level balcony for an even better view of the impressive countryside. The interiors of the home have been outfitted to exacting standards, featuring finely crafted furniture, exposed wooden rafters, soothing light colors and cooling AC to ensure the ideal temperature is always maintained.This is one of the finest villas for guests looking to make the most of the island’s celebrated beaches. Choose your spot for the day from 7 beaches that all lie within 10 kilometres of this home, ranging from peaceful and secluded strands, to sunny and sandy spots that offer good access to local bars and restaurants. Visit the peaceful laneways and sunny squares of local villages like Ano Mera, relaxing with a cool ice-cream or tasty lunch in one of the many tavernas of the town. The unique geography of the island offers something for everybody, from tackling diving or kite-surfing off the isthmus beach of Omos, to making an offshore trip to the historic ruins of Delos.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: From the hills above Agios Ioannis Beach, watch as sailboats navigate the sea on the west coast of Mykonos. Wake up to the ocean view, no matter which bedroom you choose. Spend your afternoon swinging in a hammock, stretched out in a sun lounger, or floating around the pool. For a closer look, walk 4-minutes to the beach. Then, head 4km to Mykonos Town for dinner.Aura’s Cycladic-style is evident in a glance. White stucco walls, exposed wood, and natural stone deliver the authenticity of the Greek islands. Flow through open concept interiors out wide doorways to the terrace, inviting fresh sea breeze and warm sunlight to fill the villa. Prepare meals in the updated kitchen on marble countertops. And, pamper yourself with the highest-end fixtures in the spa-inspired ensuites.On hotter days, relax inside with the air conditioning, a good movie on Smart TV, and Wi-Fi. If you’re ready for the heat, work on your tan from one of the sunbeds. After dinner, turn up the wireless sound system, mix a few tropical cocktails, and gather on the terrace lounge. If it looks like it’s going to be a late one, hop in the pool to recharge your batteries or fire up the barbeque for a late-night snack.If you’d rather hit the town, Skandinavian Bar is the spot to dance until the sun comes up. Don’t feel like dancing? Try out some of Tropicana Beach Bar’s signature cocktails while you dig your feet into the sand of Paradise Beach. For dinner, you’ll find fresh seafood pretty much everywhere, but the Little Venice area is a favorite spot among locals. On the way, stop in for a picture at the windmills.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Just outside the bustling downtown of Mykonos, Villa Aries provides unparalleled ocean views and privacy, as well as a prime location. An oval infinity pool is the centre piece of the generous terrace, and just above its edge, the beautiful Aegean Sea. At Aries, colourful sunsets are easily enjoyed from many different vantage points. Make sure to bring a camera.Cycladic Architecture is the epitome of Greek construction. An old world style that remains atop the pinnacle of island luxury today, and throughout our history. Maybe it’s the lack of hard edges, the simple construction, or the free flow from indoor to outdoor space, but something about the greek style makes relaxation imminent. Most of the interior and exterior spaces are joined by wide archways, creating an open concept aesthetic and easy traffic flow from room to room. The living room has comfortable couches and armchairs, with space for the whole group. The dining area is elegant and bright, with two chandeliers hanging above the eight person table. And, the kitchen’s appliances, countertops, and cabinetry are all updated to the highest standards of modern design.With seven bedrooms and accommodations for fourteen, Aries is perfect for a large family getaway, a corporate retreat, or a small wedding ceremony. On the terrace, you’ll find alfresco dining for sixteen, a barbeque, wet bar, sun loungers, swimming pool, and the spectacular ocean view. Inside, guests will enjoy television, a sound system, Wi-Fi, and air condition. And, there’s daily housekeeping too.Aries estate is separated in to three buildings. The main house contains the shared spaces and master bedroom. Each of the guest houses have three bedrooms. And, all of the bedrooms have their own ensuite bathrooms and unique ocean views.A greek vacation isn’t complete without a trip to the beach, luckily there are several amazing options within a few miles of Aries. Platys Gialos Beach is a great one to start with.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Enjoy relaxed island living indoors and out at Nadal. This thoughtfully designed Paros vacation rental makes the most of its location just outside the town of Naousa with a sunny courtyard and bedrooms opening to a terrace. It’s an ideal retreat that makes it easy for up to sixteen friends or extended family to stay close to several classic Greek-island beaches.The villa’s central courtyard features an infinity pool, loungers, al-fresco dining and a barbecue, all within listening distance of an outdoor sound system. You can even set up the home theater to watch a movie outside after sunset. Other amenities range from an exercise room to Wi-Fi, air conditioning and a security system.Inside, Nadal’s expansive living areas are filled with natural light and natural textures such as wood ceiling beams and leather sofas. Concrete floors, however, add a subtly urban touch to the living room, dining room and a fully equipped kitchen with a breakfast bar.There are three bedrooms in the main house of this luxury property and five in guest houses; all have double beds and en-suite bathrooms. Several of the guest-house bedrooms have their own private entrances, making them perfect for couples wanting a honeymoon-style escape, as well as features like lounge areas and kitchenettes. Like the common living areas, the bedrooms are bright and modern, with an eclectic mix of furnishings that makes them feel like the home of a stylish friend.You could easily spend your holiday lounging by the pool, savoring the company of family and friends. But if you’d like to explore the island, it’s less than a 10-minute drive to both Kolymbithres Beach, plus shopping and dining in the town of Naousa. The cities of Paros and Lefkes are a bit farther, but still within easy reach for a day trip—or even just an evening out.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take in a stunning infinity pool that visually blends with the blue Mediterranean beyond, as Greek islands shimmer in the distance. Experience the villa’s sumptuous white rooms, expansive deck and profusion of special extras, such a private swimming cove and wine cellar. Located on the quiet south-western corner of vibrant Mykonos, this villa is brushed by the sea that laps over the rocks below.Surrounded by the balmy climate of the Cyclades island chain, Villa Aphrodite ensures total comfort by providing full air-conditioning throughout the spacious rooms, with the refreshing infinity pool and sea-access for those looking to dive in for a rewarding swim. Located in a private coastal location, the villa has been designed with a dose of light, maritime colors and tastefully sculpted fixtures. Guests will sink into the welcoming living area upon arrival, which is complete with a huge, wall-length comfort sofa. The welcoming bedrooms all provide excellent views, while the terrace garden adds a dash of vibrant, green color to the serene seascape that stretches beyond.Mykonos is one of Greece’s best known destination islands, in part due to the fantastic restaurant and culinary scene, as well as the historical importance that these islands hold in the mythological pantheon. Make the short trip into the collection of striking white buildings that make up Mykonos town, savoring an evening of famously delicious seafood washed down with characterful retsina wine, or experiencing the atmosphere of the town’s renowned bar scene. Experience the rugged beauty of the island via a stimulating guided hike along the windswept north coast, or cruise out for a wonderful day-trip to the history-drenched island of Delos, reported birthplace of Apollo, where ruined temples, abandoned theatres and haunting mosaics are yours to discover.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Nestling on the south-western coast of Paros, Villa Earvin is bathed in the dazzling light of the Mediterranean sun. Looking out over the island of Antiparos, this sensational villa encompasses the very best of Greek island living. From your manicured garden and stone terrace, you are just a short walk from an idyllic pebble beach. Closer to home you can dive in to your glorious turquoise pool against the backdrop of the glittering sea. As the crimson sun sets over the Aegean Sea you can unwind in the shaded pergola.Villa Earvin is a blissful property in a breath-taking location. Built in traditional Cycladean-style it boasts impressive stone clad walls and acres of space. At its heart lies the magnificent iridescent swimming pool. Around the far edge of its inviting crystal clear waters you’ll find a stretch of sand where you can recline on a sun lounger. Next to the house itself you can soak up the sun on the stone terrace or escape to the sheltered verandas furnished with comfy chairs and a dining table.Divided between the main house and two guest house bungalows, Villa Earvin is a welcoming, expansive host. You can dine al fresco in the sun-dappled pergola or inside at an elegant glass table. The villa’s interior is tastefully decorated in calming, muted shades and enhanced by clean and contemporary furnishings. Its sleek modern kitchen is embellished by soft pine surfaces. Designed to stylishly cater for comfort, Villa Earvin provides an uncluttered setting where you can simply relax.The villa’s luxurious bedrooms provide you with cool, calm havens which will help soothe you to sleep. The master suite is the only bedroom in the main house and encompasses the entire upper floor. Here you can recline in your king-sized bed or take an invigorating shower in the gleaming en-suite before stepping out on to your private terrace. The remaining en-suite bedrooms are divided neatly between two bungalows. Each opens out on to the sunny lower terrace and, with a mixture of twin and double beds, give you total flexibility.From Villa Earvin you can indulge yourself in a quintessential Paros vacation. You can laze away days lounging by your delightful pool or beachcombing on the secluded pebble beach. A short drive away you’ll find the attractive seaside village of Aliki. This picturesque port is renowned for its seafood restaurants and relaxed atmosphere. Close by it the Aegean winds provide ideal conditions for windsurfing and water sports.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Rest your arms on the edge of the infinity pool as the sun sinks into the ocean's horizon at this Cycladic-masterpiece on the rocky coast of Mykonos. Hop out of the pool to a lounge chair and use the day's last light to help warm up for an exciting evening. After an alfresco seafood dinner, rally the troops for a night of bar-hopping, dancing, and maybe a trip to the Mykonos Paradise Beach.The Big Blue is a perfect example of ancient Cycladic architecture, showing off its soft edges, rounded corners, and arched-doorways. However, this modern version enjoys much more spacious interiors. Wander stone paths and curved hallways to find the perfect ocean-vantage point, a spot to curl up and read, or space to socialize with the group. Then, head outside to watch sailboats navigate the harbor.On a quiet night in, Blue's long sofa and satellite TV pairs perfectly with a bowl of popcorn and a blanket. In the afternoon, spend a little time working on your tan from a sun lounger or find a shady spot on the terrace for a quick nap. If it's looking like it's going to be one of those nights, turn up the sound system and unleash your inner mixologist behind the terrace bar.The first thing you'll want to do in Mykonos is wander the narrow alleys, lookouts, and stairways that make up this iconic hillside town. Surely you'll find a handful of bars, restaurants, and boutique shops to check out along the way. For dinner, sample traditional Greek seafood at AvliTou Thodori. In the mood to shop? Matogianni Street is the island's most busy market.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Sun, sea and sparkling white walls: all the charm of the Greek islands is on full display at Nautilos. This traditionally inspired Mykonos vacation rental boasts sweeping views of Agios Ioannis Bay and a location close to shopping, local tavernas, and Mykonos Town. Reserve its four bedrooms for a getaway with a few other couples, a holiday with extended family or even a sun-kissed island honeymoon.Succulent plantings and local stone create a private setting for the villa's pergola-covered sitting and dining areas, sunny lounge area and swimming pool overlooking the sea. A wood-fired barbecue makes it easy to prep and serve dinner outdoors; if you'd prefer to spend the evening inside, the television and Wi-Fi are ready to entertain.Inside Nautilos, details like white stucco walls and beamed ceilings lend a certain romance to the living and dining areas and the fully equipped kitchen. The rooms flow from one to the other, connected by archways, and open to the terrace so you can let the sea breezes in. Vintage nautical instruments, model ships and lanterns used throughout are further nods to the waterfront setting.There are three bedrooms in the main house of this luxury property and one in a guest studio; all four have en-suite bathrooms and air conditioning. In the main house, there are two bedrooms with double beds and one bedroom with two twin beds. The guest-house bedroom has a double bed.Though Nautilos itself is in a beautiful spot, it's also just a short drive from the gorgeously clear waters of Kapari Beach and the lively tavernas of Agios Ioannis. You'll find shopping close at hand, but for a wider range of boutiques, restaurants and clubs, all amid incredibly photogenic traditional architecture, make the drive into Mykonos Town.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Dubai’s newest island, Bluewaters, is where you’ll find the legendary hospitality of Ceasar’s Palace and its triple-ocean-view Julius Suite. Start your mornings on Ceasar’s private beach, walking through the warm sand as the cool tide gently washes over your feet. Getting a relaxing start is a great idea because things like indoor skiing, diving with sharks, and kite surfing are all pretty common in Dubai, or, you could always just hang out on the beach.Open concept design ensures that the ocean view is ever-present throughout Julius, making it a perfect host for special occasions and group gatherings. The formal dining space has seats for 8, and the balcony is a great spot for post-dinner cocktails. Back inside, the grayscale color scheme of the villa gives off an elegant vibe while the warm wood tones of the divider-walls create a relaxing, natural atmosphere.Included with your stay, Ceasar’s daily housekeeping, valet, and laundry service will help take away what little stress remains, leaving you with even more time to enjoy Cove Beach, 5 on-site restaurants, and the state of the art gym. And, if you need to sneak away for a bit, drop the kids off with the Empire Club, an interactive space that is sure to keep them entertained.Dubai is truly a city of limitless possibility. For the adrenaline junkies, everything from sky diving to scuba diving is at your fingertips. Rather keep your feet on the ground? Try for the course record at Emirates Golf Club; it’s a 61 by Ernie Els. After an exciting day, head for dinner, drinks, and dancing at Dubai’s Marina District or visit the largest retail entertainment center on the planet at the Mall of the Emirates.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Gaze out over city views on Dubai's newest island, Bluewaters, from the legendary comfort of Ceasar's Palace. With a lengthy list of World-class amenities included, you'll have plenty to see and do without leaving the residence. Although you're in Dubai, so you may want to check out sites like Mall of the Emirates, Palm Jumeirah, and the Dubai Zoo, to name a few. There's plenty to discover within a few kilometers of Ceasars, or, you could just relax on their private beach.Gather the group for a casual breakfast, stretching along the countertop/bar that separates the wall kitchen from the rest of the open concept living area. After, kick back on the L-shaped sofa, turn on the satellite television, and relax before beginning another exciting day. If you're thinking of hosting, Ceasar's grayscale color scheme with gold accents sets an elegant tone that will add an extra touch of sophistication to any occasion.During your stay, the complimentary housekeeping, valet, and laundry service will ensure you have nothing to worry about except working on your tan. 5 hotel restaurants make it easy to find the perfect meal for every occasion, and when you're done with dinner, Ceasar's bars are ready for the after party. And, the Empire and Roam clubs provide interactive places for kids and teens to hang out if you need to sneak away for a bit.Have the morning off? Challenge yourself to the course record, a 61 set by Ernie Els, at Emirates Golf Club. This scenic course is home to over 100 species of local flora and fauna set amongst fairways that wind through dynamic city and ocean views. If you're looking for family fun, let the kids run wild at Wild Wadi Waterpark as you enjoy a cocktail or two at the tiki bar. Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Take in the calm splendor of the Cyclades from this gorgeous villa located on Paros’s southern shore. Like the blue horizon beyond, the property utilizes open space and long, straight lines, paired with calming white colors. The villa’s seaview pool and huge stone rooms are moments from pristine beaches, the charming villages of Drios, plus an ancient Byzantine roadway with truly excellent views.You will find yourself lingering over breakfast at Villa Selene, with the expansive view of the sea and the calm expanse of the Lolantonis countryside convincing you to stay put for one more tasty Greek coffee. Guests will love the gentle echo of footsteps on stone in the great rooms of the villa, with a huge amount of space giving the impression of the home as truly being part of the landscape. Wood and white paint personify the living room, complete with big, welcoming couches and top-tier entertainment system, while the breakfast bar and carved table afford fine functionality to the fully-equipped kitchen. Relax by the fresh and reviving pool in 1 of the artfully-designed sun recliners, or savor a satisfying fresh lunch of locally-sourced delicacies at the court-like dining terrace, where the afternoon shadows slowly revolve around the figures enjoying the sheer atmosphere of this villa.Guests are situated amongst the unique calm and natural beauty of the island of Paros at Villa Selene. Just a short walk away are the sunlit sands of the Lolantonis beach, where guests can dive into the clearest of Mediterranean waters. Just a short drive provides access to hillside villages, where traditional Greek tavernas await with cool drinks and a fine choice of island cuisine. A ruined Byzantine road lies close by for walking excursions, offering views into the fascinating past of the island and seascape. Guests can enjoy quick access to cosmopolitan Athens via the close-by airport and other beautiful islands via the nearby ferry port.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Walk along a private beach, dine in one of 5 amazing restaurants, and sip cocktails at the poolside bar, all without leaving Ceasar’s Palace Bluewaters in Dubai. You’ll get an incredible lay of the land from this dynamic city-view suite. And what a city it is. Diving with sharks, skiing on indoor slopes, and some of the World’s most pristine beachfront await. With such limitless possibilities, you’ll want to have an inspiring place to plan out your schedule. Here it is.Ceasar’s grayscale color scheme is accented by warm wood tones and touches of gold, setting an elegant tone for any occasion. You and your crew will surely appreciate the social atmosphere created by the villa’s open concept layout. The breakfast bar is the link between the living room and the kitchen, making it easy to keep up with the conversation, even when prepping meals. And, each bedroom captures a scenic view of the city.Daily housekeeping, a valet, and laundry service will alleviate any leftover stress during your stay, allowing you to focus on enjoying Ceasars Palace and Dubai. Keep up with your fitness routines in the state of the art gym. Cool off in the swimming pool. If you’re traveling with kids and teens, the Empire and Roam clubs have exciting programs to keep them entertained if you need some adult time.Dubai’s marina district isn’t just the place to charter a private yacht or fishing trip. It’s also home to some of the city’s freshest seafood restaurants, buzzing bars, and vibrant nightclubs. If you feel like shopping, the Mall of the Emirates, being the largest retail/entertainment center on the planet, should satisfy your every desire. And, if there’s a golfer in the group, Emirates Golf Club is a beautiful way to experience over 100 species of local flora and fauna while you challenge yourself to a round.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
